results.definition: (criminal law) a pleading describing some wrong or offense
examples: he was arrested on a charge of larceny

results.definition: move quickly and violently
a quantity of explosive to be set off at one time
examples: this cartridge has a powder charge of 50 grains

results.definition: the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons
examples: the battery needed a fresh charge

results.definition: cause to be agitated, excited, or roused
examples: The speaker charged up the crowd with his inflammatory remarks

results.definition: (psychoanalysis) the libidinal energy invested in some idea or person or object
examples: Freud thought of cathexis as a psychic analog of an electrical charge

results.definition: demand payment
examples: Will I get charged for this service?

results.definition: direct into a position for use
examples: He charged his weapon at me

results.definition: blame for, make a claim of wrongdoing or misbehavior against
examples: he charged the director with indifference

results.definition: request for payment of a debt
examples: they submitted their charges at the end of each month

results.definition: cause to be admitted; of persons to an institution
file a formal charge against
examples: The suspect was charged with murdering his wife

results.definition: to make a rush at or sudden attack upon, as in battle
give over to another for care or safekeeping
provide (a device) with something necessary
attention and management implying responsibility for safety
a special assignment that is given to a person or group
examples: his charge was deliver a message

results.definition: heraldry consisting of a design or image depicted on a shield
a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something
examples: the judge's charge to the jury

results.definition: attribute responsibility to
examples: The tragedy was charged to her inexperience

results.definition: an assertion that someone is guilty of a fault or offence
examples: the newspaper published charges that Jones was guilty of drunken driving

results.definition: the swift release of a store of affective force
impose a task upon, assign a responsibility to
examples: He charged her with cleaning up all the files over the weekend

results.definition: assign a duty, responsibility or obligation to
examples: She was charged with supervising the creation of a concordance

results.definition: an impetuous rush toward someone or something
examples: the wrestler's charge carried him past his adversary
the battle began with a cavalry charge

results.definition: a person committed to your care
examples: the teacher led her charges across the street

results.definition: cause formation of a net electrical charge in or on
examples: charge a conductor

results.definition: energize a battery by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to discharge
examples: I need to charge my car battery

results.definition: enter a certain amount as a charge
examples: he charged me $15

results.definition: fill or load to capacity
examples: charge the wagon with hay

results.definition: financial liabilities (such as a tax)
examples: the charges against the estate

results.definition: instruct (a jury) about the law, its application, and the weighing of evidence
instruct or command with authority
examples: The teacher charged the children to memorize the poem

results.definition: lie down on command, of hunting dogs
make an accusatory claim
examples: The defense attorney charged that the jurors were biased

results.definition: pay with a credit card; pay with plastic money; postpone payment by recording a purchase as a debt
examples: Will you pay cash or charge the purchase?

results.definition: place a heraldic bearing on
examples: charge all weapons, shields, and banners

results.definition: saturate
examples: The room was charged with tension and anxiety

results.definition: set or ask for a certain price
examples: How much do you charge for lunch?
This fellow charges $100 for a massage

results.definition: the price charged for some article or service
examples: the admission charge
